snippet: A lawsuit has drawn attention to American service members’ allegations that they are being gouged at pay phones in Germany’s Leipzig-Halle Airport.
abstract: Sgt Richard Corder has filed a class-action lawsuit against BBG Global, the telecommunications company that handles calls from Leipzig-Halle Airport in Germany, a major transit hub for US soldiers; case has drawn attention to soldiers' growing indignation about price-gouging when they call home from the airport; Corder was charged $51 dollars for what he estimates was a two-minute call.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit has drawn attention to American service members’ allegations that they are being gouged at pay phones in Germany’s Leipzig-Halle Airport.
